# Question 2. Video Summary

> Summarize the Posit video on Quarto's capabilities.

## Question 2. Response

The Posit video consistent on learning Quarto which is a open source publishing system with text and code to produce different formatted documents. Lua filters give more power to execute the code steps then R markdown. The video covered Quarto's concepts, support for multiple languages besides R and compatibility with other IDE such as VS Code, R Studio, and Jupyter.

A big difference in the structure that differs from R Markdown is the YAML code chunk, visual editor mode, layout tools such as Pandoc divs, callout blocks, tabsets, and interactive documents without needed a server. The rendering and publishing of the Quarto documents in Quarto Pub, GitHub Pages, Netify, and R Studio Connect. Collaboration between R and Python as well as the change in R Markdown such as syntax text formatting such as headers and code. The batteries included shows future support in additional components featured in Quarto.
